subject: Re: Firmware update broke pedals (interference)
description_text: Thank you very much. That fixed my problem! I just wanted to say it has been a pleasure to own your products and your customer service is top notch. I will be recommending your products to many friends. - Jason Purdie On Aug 12, 2025, at 5:08 PM, "support@simsonn.com" <support@simsonn.com> wrote: Hi Jason Purdie, Please make sure your SIMSONN Manager is updated to the latest 2.1.0 version, then update the firmware to disable the RX axis. In the “Settings - Update” section, click “Manual Firmware Update,” then navigate to the pedals-firmware folder → pedals folder → and select the proxultra.sfu file to update. This firmware will disable the 4th axis. On Tue, 12 Aug at 5:45 PM , Jason Purdie <jason.purdie@icloud.com> wrote: Hello, I have been enjoying the use of the Simsonn Pro X Ultra pedals for the last couple months. They have been working great. I upgraded to a new PC and reinstalled the Simsonn software. It worked fine for a week and then I noticed there was a firmware update available from late July. I completed the update successfully and now the pedals are causing interference with every game. I tested it with a joystick input tester and it is showing a signal on channel rX. Normally, the signals should be throttle on channel X, brake on channel Y, and clutch on channel Z. I have never seen any signal coming through on channel rX before. I think something in the firmware update broke it. Is there a way to revert back to the previous firmware verson? I have included a screenshot of the joystick input tester software showing the interference. Thanks, - Jason Purdie jason.purdie@icloud.com 2612:4206036
